name: Ch.13ABaseConvo2
_source: speak;Ewan;Hehe.|Prince Innes!|Can you come look at this strange bug I found?
speak;Innes;A bug?|What sort of insect would be of interest to me?
speak;Ewan;It's really neat!|It's right over here in this box.|You just need to look really closely...
speak;Innes;...|I see.|You've rigged a spring-loaded surprise in that box.|There's a small wire visible on the side, and your posture suggests anticipation.|You're not as subtle as you think, boy.
speak;Ewan;Wha-?|How did you know?!|I spent hours setting that up!
speak;Innes;I am Prince Innes of Frelia.|My tactical mind is unmatched.|Did you truly believe I would fall for such an elementary trap?
speak;Ewan;I really thought it would work...|It worked on everyone else...

speak;Innes;Your mistake was telegraphing your intent.|Your excessive enthusiasm signaled deception.|The slight tremor in your voice betrayed nervousness.|And I noticed you positioned yourself beyond the box's blast radius.
speak;Ewan;Really?|I didn't realize I gave away so many clues...

speak;Innes;Furthermore, you chose a location with too much foot traffic.|Anyone would question why a "rare bug" would be in such a common area.|Had you chosen a secluded garden area, maintained plausible ignorance in your demeanor, and controlled your breathing...|The trap might have had a chance of success.
speak;Ewan;Huh...|So if I were to try again, I should...|Wait, you're actually giving me tips?
speak;Innes;I'm explaining why your childish attempt failed.|To demonstrate the superiority of my observational skills.|Not to encourage further foolishness.
speak;Ewan;Right, right!|I totally understand.|So a secluded location works better...|And I need to control my breathing and act natural...|What about the design of the trap itself?

speak;Innes;The mechanism was rudimentary but functional.|However, the spring was too loud when compressed.|A proper ambush should be silent until the moment of activation.|Also, your paint choice was obvious against the box's color.|Subtlety is key.
speak;Ewan;I see!|So I should use materials that blend with the surroundings...|And find a quieter spring mechanism...
speak;Innes;I suppose—|Wait.|Why am I continuing this conversation?|I have important matters to attend to.|Good day.
speak;Ewan;Thank you, Prince Innes!|This has been very educational!|I can't wait to try out these new techniques...|Maybe on someone important...
speak;Innes;Hold a moment.|I did not give you permission to use this information.|Especially not on "someone important."

speak;Ewan;Oh, of course not!|I would never think of using your expert tactical advice to create the ultimate prank...|That would be wrong of me!|But hypothetically, a quieter spring and natural-colored paint would work better...
speak;Innes;Listen carefully, boy.|If I discover you've engineered any pranks based on my advice...|There will be consequences.|Is that understood?
speak;Ewan;Crystal clear, Prince Innes!|No pranks at all!|Especially not during the war meeting tomorrow...
speak;Innes;What war meeting?|There is no scheduled—|You're attempting to make me paranoid.|This is childish.
speak;Innes;No.|But I've clearly made a tactical error in this conversation.|Saleh will hear about this.
speak;Ewan;Oh come on!|I'm just having a little fun!|Besides, I learned so much from you!|You're really smart, Prince Innes.
speak;Innes;Your flattery doesn't work on me.|Just...|Stay out of trouble.|And stay away from me for the foreseeable future.
speak;Ewan;Secluded location...|Natural demeanor...|Silent mechanism...|This is going to be my masterpiece!
